activities.loc: MDB Check Monitor & Posted Calendar for Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric Dong

records.addlTxt:
4:10 PM Defendant Eric Dong in court.  Attorney Andrew Joseph Harrington in court for Eric Dong.  Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court relates. Attorney Harrington relates that Defendant waives the preliminary hearing. Defendant relates. Court relates and conducts colloquy of Defendant. The Court finds Defendant is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waiving preliminary hearing. Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial. No address or phone number change. 
Arraignment set for 12/16/2022 at 9:00 am In Person.
Arraignment scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Attorney fees.  Andrew Harrington appointed.  Repay $100.00 per month starting 09/10/2022.
Preliminary hearing on August 24, 2022 at 04:15 pm.
$100.00/month to begin 9/10/22 for repayment to attorney Andrew Harrington.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
11:22 AM Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Eric Dong in court.
Does not qualify for Public Defender.  Court instructs him to complete the blue form and come back in to court.
11:41 Case recalled.  Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Eric Dong in court.  Attorney Andrew Joseph Harrington in court for Eric Dong.
Defendant sworn.  Blue form presented.  Court appoints Andrew Harrington and orders repayment of $100.00 per month beginning 9/10/22 by wage assignment.  Reading of Complaint waived and preliminary hearing requested.  Bond continued.  Next hearing may be by zoom.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 04:15 pm.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473.

1:04 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Eric Dong appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Alex Kitto appeared for today by video for Eric Dong. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint.
Address and phone numbers confirmed.
Defendant must call the public defender's office today to determine eligibility.  If the defendant does not qualify for public defender representation, the defendant must complete a Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency also known as the blue form in order for the court to consider appointing an attorney. 

AIA set; must appear in person.

(MS and Bond scanned to jail)
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
